result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shane M Bearheart

records.addlTxt: 1:06 PM Cases 22CF127 and 22CF161 called together.  Defendant Shane M Bearheart not in court.  Attorney Fredric B. Anderson appeared by video for Shane M Bearheart.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases were set for arraignment.  Def fails to appear.  No info from Atty Anderson.  State asks for warrant and forfeiture of cash.  Court orders warrant, $750 cash; forfeits cash bond posted.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
11:26 AM Cases 22CF127 and 22CF161 called together.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shane M Bearheart in court.  Attorney Fredric B. Anderson appeared by video for Shane M Bearheart. Cases on for Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files informations mirroring complaint. Bond continues.  Atty Anderson recites current offer- waive prelims, plead to fleeing, DRI other counts and cases, PSI, free to argue.
Arraignment scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
2:21 PM Cases 22CF127 and 22CF161 called together.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shane M Bearheart in court.  Attorney Fredric B. Anderson in court for Shane M Bearheart. Cases on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaints, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG pleas to misdemeanor counts.  WTLPH.  Discussion of past-due fines and fees.  Court willing to drop to $50 for August and September; will revisit in September.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Initial appearance on August 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

2:41 PM Cases 22CF127 and 22CF161 called together.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shane M Bearheart in court.  Def appears without counsel- applied for and eligible for PD, but one has not yet been appointed.  Def wants to adjourn to get counsel.
Initial appearance scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Initial appearance on July 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Further proceedings on July 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant must post $500 to cover Burnett County Cases 22CF127 and 22GF167 to be released from custody.  The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. Subject to random testing of breath, blood or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion. No driving without a valid driver's license and permission from the owner.
